The MOONLIGHT reflects off the calm dark body of water. W in the distance FAINT LIGHTS on shore indicate a hint of PIRATE LAIR known as HARARDHERE. The only sound heard is the LAPPING WAVES that strike the ship’s side. The TETHERED PIRATES’ BOAT is seen in the foreground again, through THERMAL VISION GOGGLES, the ‘Thermal Vision POV’ moves steadily closer.

The BOUND HOSTAGES are being shoved and kicked into the center of the ship’s HOLD. High above the HOLD are open C DOORS that reveal the dark night sky. TWO PIRATES stand g above the ‘HOLD’ watching the HOSTAGES being abused below Waiting in the hold are another FIFTEEN PIRATES who are sitting on STACKS OF CARGO drinking and smoking. The whol environment has the feel of a distorted amphitheater whos attendees want blood. SHIP’S HOLD The HOSTAGES are dragged into the center of the METAL CAR AREA. The PIRATES mock their pleas for ‘help’ and burning CIGARETTES and empty BEER BOTTLES are tossed at the FRENC MEN. The surly PIRATES pass around large joints of MARIJU while gyrating on the STACKED CARGO.
Ultra Extreme CLOSE UP of a THERMAL VISION GOGGLES LENS a rises into view. The individual wearing them is not seen.

Panning around we see the DECK is clear. The THERMAL VISI then scans the UPPER DECK of the ship and this area is al clear. The THERMAL VISION IMAGE now travels forward toward the C HOLD. A PIRATE GUARD seated on the EDGE of the cargo hold observing below.  10 13 14 15

SHIP’S HOLD The PIRATE LEADER bellows orders and the PIRATE CREW kick HOSTAGES to their knees, while dragging them into a strai line. The majority of the surrounding PIRATES hurl insult The LEADER orders another PIRATE holding a small VIDEO CA to begin filming. Around them are STACKS of the cargo, wh is SALT. The LEADER paces behind the doomed HOSTAGES and begins to speak in English, which is the SOMALI’S second language.

(accented English) We had these men too long! Three months! Too, too long! Now someone here (eyes the hostages) has to pay! Your company has had so much time to pay! But you give nothing!! You do not care about your people. Don’t want them? Then we do not care!

The LEADER angrily gestures to the PIRATE beside him. The PIRATE disdainfully drags a HOSTAGE forward and yanks bound hands upward. The GAGGED HOSTAGE’S muffled cries for mercy fall on deaf ears. The PIRATE GANG clamors for blood.

(playing to the camera) These workers need their hands! But the owners of this ship do not want to pay! That means to me that you do not care for these men anymore. We do not care too. Full of adrenaline, the PIRATES aim their array of WEAPON upward and are about to fire when the RED BEAM from a LAS LIGHT appears on the LEADER’S CHEST.

(to his men) No! (in Somali) Don’t shoot!! Who is there? The PIRATE with the PORTABLE CAMERA pans upward. It recor the barely discernible OUTLINES of SIX DARKLY CLAD MEN. ( camera’s footage will be haphazardly recorded and used in later scene.) EXT. SHIP’S DECK - NIGHT The SIX MERCENARIES gathered around the ship’s HOLD are k as THE EXPENDABLES. BARNEY ROSS: Group leader and strategist. In his day a re holder for his blinding speed and accuracy with COMBAT PISTOLS. HALE CAESAR: Long Barrel Weapon Specialist, especially custom, one of a kind, full-auto shotguns. Well-adjusted, pleasant, outspoken, but ruthless in battle, friends with BARNEY for 10 years. LEE CHRISTMAS: Former SAS and a savant with anything that a blade. YING YANG: Thoughtful, deadly and a master at ‘close quar combat.’ He’s a man who’s always meditating on how he sho live his life. TOLL ROAD: His imposing size and battle scarred appearanc belie his special DEMOLITION SKILLS and calm intellect.

When all else fails, he simply employs his brutal but brilliant fighting capabilities to shatter every bone in opponent’s body. He wears special GLOVES with protruding STUDS and METAL KNEE PADS. GUNNAR JENSEN: A big combat veteran who’s an expert in PRECISION SNIPING, but the years of stress, isolation and cynicism have spiraled him downwards into an unwinnable w of substance abuse and untamable mood swings. leaps from cover and heaves a KNIFE at a PIRATE who is reloading, then fires his WEAPON three times at a PIRATE dives safely behind a CARGO STACK. The PIRATE now fires a BARNEY. TOLL ROAD suddenly appears behind the PIRATE and snaps his NECK.

swings around a CARGO STACK and catches TWO PIRATES broad with his .45. GUNNAR’S Drugged eyes are as wide as portholes as he snaps around corner and catches CHRISTMAS dead in his sights. Though t feet away, GUNNAR is aiming right between his teammate’s eyes.

Why?
It’s more honest - You know what I mean. CHURCH’S eyes bore into BARNEY’S trying to get a read on where he’s coming from.

Much better - The President of the country, General Ruben Garza, overthrew the government and for the past year or so, his death squads have decimated the population - He even had two of our company’s soil researchers killed, we're told he was in on the execution. He hands a PICTURE over from a FOLDER. BARNEY studies the PHOTO. This one of a tin pot despot of man, in an over medaled uniform, his eyes hold the hint o madness.
(pushing the drama) That’s Garza. His so-called ‘Red Guards’ kill unarmed woman and children without thinking twice.
(unaffected) ...Yeah.
You have any children? Mr. Ross?
I relate.
I got a truck and a seaplane.
Right - Anyway, the majority of the people go hungry while -
Wait -
Yes?
Let me stop you, what people eat isn’t my concern, what they pay is.
No foreplay here. (tensing) (MORE )

CHURCH (cont'd) The people I represent won’t do business with a government that could collapse in a few years or one that could become more radical. CHURCH stares straight into BARNEY’S eyes. He hands over FOLDER.
More details - And we have arranged a contact - A well financed mercenary operation could succeed.
You’re wasting my time. What d’you want?
(barely holding it together) I don’t like your attitude.
Makes two of us. What do you want?
Garza permanently removed.
Furniture’s removed - Be specific.
(hardens ) We want him gone -
- Dead?
Yes, dead. His soldiers dead. His half-assed government, dead. Specific enough?
Yeah.
Well?
How many outfits did you ask before you got around to us?
4l 4lA
Why?
Ten? Twenty?
What’s it matter?
Must be gettin’ desperate.

This your way of starting negotiations? Barney heads back to his truck. Once inside, he takes out MINIATURE VIDEO CAMERA and withdrawing the MEMORY CHIP, p it into the PC on the seat beside him. Hitting the play button, he studies the CLOSE-UP FOOTAGE of CHURCH request he attack the island of VILENA. Having seen enough, he cl the LAPTOP and the scene goes black.
The PALACE is old and solid, and has a forboding aura. La LIGHTS shine down from the BARBED WIRED walls that surrou this horrible structure.
GENERAL GARZA, a hefty paranoid, with a volatile personal stares at a beautiful POOL that lies below him.
General!

GARZA, still in his bathrobe, comes striding through the dimly lit, EERIE TUNNELS, followed by his ELITE GUARDS. O either side in small cave like cells, peasant workers are engaged in unloading WHITE POWDER bricks and placing them stacks on wooden pallets. GARZA comes upon more of his guards surrounding a trembli PEASANT WORKER and his exhausted, small, mid-thirties WIF and 15 YR OLD SON. One of the guards holds a SMALL PLASTI BAG of the white powder, which he hands to GARZA, who reg it calmly.
The PHOTOGRAPHER snaps off a steady stream of STILL SHOTS Garza comes face to face with the terror stricken peasant All dialogue is in SPANISH.
(calmly in Spanish) Did you steal from me?
No. Please Excellency. I would never steal from you! Never!
(in Spanish) Everything that comes out of the ground is not yours, it’s mine. You know that, yes?
I swear on the lives of my children!
(in Spanish) I understand, but if I can’t see inside of you - How do I know if you’re telling the truth? And then, suddenly....

From out of the darkness comes a bone jarring explosion t causes ALL present to jump out of their skins. From the shadows emerges an American, JAMES MONROE, a rou CIA Officer in his 40’s. His hair is slicked back, his demeanor calm, but in his eyes the blackness that inspire fear. Backing him up are three lethal looking Americans, Blackwater types. PAINE, and his TWO EX-AMERICAN OPERATIV In Monroe’s hand, a Desert Eagle, smoke still curling fro the barrel.

Now you can see ‘inside him,’ and I see lies. Garza, looks from the dead man to Monroe, annoyed. MONROE moves off followed by PAINE and the TWO AMERICAN OPERATIVES. The loyal RED BERET GUARDS stare hard at the departing AMERICAN.
(dismissive) .--And he wasn’t stealing from you, he was stealing from us both. Garza looks after them, rattled, frustrated, has a hard t meeting his own private guard’s dour expression.
(in Spanish) When you want them gone, General?
(eyeing the body) Take care of this. He moves off.
BARNEY and CHRISTMAS drive through the city.
What’s wrong?
(low) I dunno - I don’t like washing my laundry in front of people.
I understand. What happened?
I had this good thing going. (shrugs ) A good thing, and it turned bad. Why do I always mess things up?
People change.
No, it’s not her, it’s me, I'm never there when I should be.
You're never there because you're insecure.
Be serious.
You can’t take being rejected.
You don’t know that.
No, you do.
You know, what I should do - Just dial back, y’know, be on my own awhile. (lost in thought) I think a guy who probably gets along best with women, is a guy who can get along without ‘em.
BARNEY glances at him, feels his angst.
If it makes you feel any better, I’m insecure too.
Really?
No.
(smiles) You've got a black heart.
Hey, it’s her loss. CHRISTMAS looks out the window thoughtfully.
This new job - It sounds bad.
But the money could be good.
Whatever happened to the code we started out with -
Which code? 32
C'mon, you know, no matter what the money, the target has to deserve it. EXT TOOL’S - EARLY EVENING BARNEY pulls the TRUCK to the curb in front of TOOL’S.
Forget code. For cash we remove those hard to get at stains, and the more I see, the more I think both sides usually deserve it.
(exiting) I’m not buyin’ into that.

Stick around. CHRISTMAS closes the door and enters TOOL’S SOCIAL CLUB. BARNEY picks up the FOLDER that CHURCH gave him, begins t look through the pictures. He comes to a GOOGLE MAP OF AN ISLAND, and it’s SEAPORT. He is so deeply in thought he d not hear anything behind him, until...
Vilena? Barney shuts the folder quickly, turns to...
Next job? BARNEY exits the truck.
(distantly) They got work there?
Shouldn’t be here, Gunnar.
Don’t replace me - I’m good.
You're sick, can’t trust a man like that. + eH
+e * HF
(hard) We were friends.
I was the ‘other’ guy’s friend. And with a final look of hurt, GUNNAR heads away.
(low) Be careful.
Threatenin’ me?
(shrugs ) ...No, the ‘other’ guy. BARNEY watches as he disappears around the corner.

44 INT. TOOL’S METAL SHOP - DUSK The camera pans down from a large EXPENDABLE LOGO painted the shop wall. The large space is crammed with an array of MACHINERY. SECTIONS of SEAPLANE, such as half of it’s FUSELAGE, are suspended from the ceiling while several METAL PROPELLERS fastened to the wall. The area is a perfect blending of t Dark Age meets the Industrial Age. BARNEY is tooling with large AIRPLANE ENGINE as the other EXPENDABLES CHRISTMAS, HALE CAESAR, YANG and TOLL ROAD lounge around the HEAVY D MACHINERY.
He said something like the population of this island is around five or six thousand, no more.
(to Christmas) How many soldiers?
How would I know?!
+ eH
Maybe couple a hundred.
Wouldn’t take much more to control a place like that and they’re most likely not well trained.
You don’t know that.
(offended) No, I don’t, I surmise.
Sounds on the crazy side. HALE CAESAR dips his SPOON into a take out CUP of GUMBO.
Maybe it’s not as crazy as it looks.
No, to a crazy person it wouldn’t - Man, they got a small army, we only got three and a half men. (indicating Yang)
(offended) Go dance some place.
Caesar, don’t wind him up.
Your food smells bad - Disgusting.
Fresh chicken gumbo’s disgustin’, but chowin’ down rats an’ the brain of a monkey isn’t?
He swore off monkey - Too expensive. (to Yang) Hey, if the smell’s botherin’ you, then throw it under the table - somethin’ down there will eat it. + eH *
(ignores them) Not so funny - (to Barney) I would like a raise.
Why?
I need more money for my son - I want to send him to a better school and buy my wife a new home.
Wait up! When did Ying Yang get a ‘family?’
You don’t ask before, I don’t tell. (to Barney) I’ve meditated on this, I want my family to be secure. I want to be a iver, not a taker. I want a raise before we die.
Nobody’s dying.
It will happen.
I hate when he takes that crap out of his demented brain and tries to put it into ours! - Yang, you’re the ‘kick the guy in the head’ guy, not the ‘bad karma’ guy.
(to Yang) Family or not, everybody gets equal shares. The target in Vilena is a General Garza, who’s regime is presenting problems.
What’s the problem?
What’s it matter?
(dryly) I can’t ask?
Their problems shouldn’t matter ‘cause we have our own set of problems and either you get rid of them first, or they get rid of you.
See your shrink lately?
(nods ) This mornin.’
What you talk about?
Ah, A.P.D. - Avoidant Personality Disorder. (they all stare)
Social inhibitions, low self worth, sensitivity to criticism and so on.
You think too much.
That’s how you get better.
Everybody's got problems, Toll Road. You’re an unusual guy, with an unusual job. Problems never go away.
When you say unusual? Meaning my ear?
Let’s focus on the job.
+ eH

Just a minute - We all know I wrestled in college, and certain injuries related to that sport, can cause trauma to the ear, such as a clot and if left unattended, the cartilage contracts forming what is known as a ‘Cauliflower ear.’
Movin’ on, Toll Road.

Not yet - I had this good friend, my roommate, who would bring up my ‘ear configuration’ all the time at parties, special events, name it. But I didn’t mind ‘cause my friend and roommate would brag about my unusual ear calling it a ‘badge of courage,’ so I felt less self conscious hearing these compliments and that pleased me, but that pleasure was short lived -
- Where’s this goin’, Toll Road?
- Into a pit of madness -

I listen to you birds - You listen to me - One mornin,’ before spring break, I overheard my roommate on the phone, makin’ comments about my quote ‘queer ear, ‘meat biscuit,’ ‘face bubble,’ an’ so on, meanin’ I’d become a gag piece simply because I looked ‘different.’ So to educate my roommate on common decency that should be afforded to anyone who appears ‘different,’ I smashed the right side of his head several times until he had a permanent cluster of cauliflower of his own. EVERYONE stares in stunned silence as they all look at TO
+e % + eH
(sighs) Nie bit of history - Anyway, me an’ Christmas will be headin’ to Vilena to see what’s what an’ if a workable strategy is possible. All the men nod.
How much it pay? BARNEY flips open his phone.
He’s gonna find that out right now.
We see CHURCH in the rear. TWO OTHER AGENTS ride up front
Speak.
We're going to Vilena - Let’s settle on a price up front.
Shoot.
Five million. The OTHER EXPENDABLES almost swallow their tongues. They exchange surprised expressions.
Get serious.
Get five.
Math isn’t your strong suit, Barney.
No. + eH
Two. TOOL’S MACHINE SHOP Cut back to BARNEY and company.
Transfer half into an offshore account, I'll give you the number later.
You got square balls.
Haven't checked lately. CHURCH hangs up. BARNEY faces his MEN who smile broadly.
Damn.
(to Christmas) ...-Let’s travel.

head_text.subj: VARIETY OF SHOTS SHOWING THE POLITICAL AND ECONOMIC CLIMA

text: In the background are Vilena’s formative mountains that a lush with dense foliage. A large GRUMMAN UF-26 ALBATROSS SEAPLANE swoops into view OCEAN SPRAY arcs beside the plane’s large PONTOONS as it powers down.
I hate this hat.
...Then take it off.
A near dilapidated CUSTOM’S OFFICE comes into view as BARNEY'S SEAPLANE rumbles into view. He cuts the engines.  52 53
BARNEY adjusts the controls, as CHRISTMAS eyes the bleak surroundings.
..-Now I know where to retire.

BARNEY and CHRISTMAS stand in front of a sunken-eyed CUST AGENT. On the wall is a LARGE PHOTO of GENERAL GARZA. Nea TWO RAWBONED SOLDIERS lounge in a pair of worn CHAIRS. A CEILING FAN overhead is barely spinning at two revolution per minute. An UNSHAVEN CUSTOMS AGENT eyes the CLOSE-UP of the men’s PASSPORTS.
How are you? You speak English? The AGENT nods smugly and looks at the SOLDIERS then look out the window.
Big plane.
We transport a lot of injured animals.
(heavy accent) Why you here? BARNEY hands over a BUSINESS CARD.
We’re on assignment. We're photographing exotic birds and such.
We're Ornithologists. The agent doesn’t quite understand. CHRISTMAS holds up a NATURE MAGAZINE with EXOTIC BIRDS on cover. BARNEY hands over his credentials.
Birdmen?
You could call it that.
(tauntingly) ..-Are you nervous?
(smiles) Nervous? Why?
You just look nervous.
(to Barney) Do I look nervous?
(smiles) No, just a little stressed.
Long flight.
Yeah. The AGENT finishes toying with them, then stamps their passports.
Thanks.
(handing back the passports) Good luck Birdman, there’s not many birds here.
No?

No, we eat most of them. The AGENT winks at the GUARDS as if he’s proud of tauntin the Americans. BARNEY and CHRISTMAS move off. THE ACTION TURNS TO SKIP F as a security camera hidden in the clock overhead takes t pictures.

BARNEY and CHRISTMAS wander the streets of the main city. Loud HONKING draws their attention. TWO MILITARY JEEPS followed by an open back MILITARY TRUCK crammed with 20 H CORE SOLDIERS rumble along the narrow main street. These SOLDIERS wear the DARK RED BERETS signifying that they ar part of GARZA’S BRUTAL ELITE TROOPS. The country’s new FLAG (an image of GENERAL GARZA) flies the corners of the hoods of all the vehicles. Though slig obscured, we see BARNEY and CHRISTMAS pass into view. The depressed, intimidated LOCALS listlessly move aside a the CONVOY approaches. THE TWO ARMY JEEPS begin blasting their horns. People mov aside. BARNEY and CHRISTMAS observe FOUR AMERICAN OPERATIVES, dressed in khaki as they pass into view in the LEAD JEEP. They then observe the SECOND JEEP in which PAINE is drivi and riding shotgun is MONROE with his slicked back hair a pair of aviator glasses, who exudes power, and menace. BARNEY and CHRISTMAS eye the men as they pass directly in front of their observation point. Christmas starts filmin them with a converted still camera.
Got ‘em?
No, I’m on vacation.
An OLD MAN struggles to push a RICKETY CART full of junk of the way. He passes in front of the TROOP TRUCK. HORNS blare. The OLD MAN stands petrified. This disrespect is n tolerated.

The TROOPS leap from the LEAD JEEP and berate the OLD MAN PAINE steps from the deep. He is wearing a conspicuous SHOULDER HOLSTER. In his thick hand is an equally thick, short, BLACK CLUB attached to a LEATHER STRAP. PAINE motions to the SOLDIERS who commence to shoving peo aside, then SMASHING the OLD MAN’S cart. MONROE coolly lo on. SOLDIERS RE-BOARD the TRANSPORT TRUCK. The LOCALS share i the man’s pain, but are terrified to show any outward emotion. PAINE starts to climb back in his JEEP. An OLDER WOMAN suddenly starts to yell curses at the TROO TRUCK. The SOLDIERS rush forward and commence to roughing up. SERGEANT OF THE GUARD grabs her and flings her agains the wall, curses her nose to nose. MONROE gestures to PAI
(in Spanish) Let's go! The SOLDIERS load up and they are gone. BARNEY and CHRIST also move out.
BARNEY and CHRISTMAS ascend the inclined cobblestone alle and pause before a RUNDOWN CANTINA. BARNEY checks the address, then proceeds to enter.

The impoverished establishment is furnished solely with t small hand hewn tables and a makeshift ‘bar’ fashioned crudely from bits of LUMBER and recycled corrugated STEEL PANELS. An OLD WOMAN BARTENDER sits idly on a stool. CHRISTMAS and BARNEY enter the dismal CANTINA, and scan t empty room. BARNEY checks his WATCH as they move to the b
They’re late. The OLD LADY asks if they want a drink.
No, gracias - CHRISTMAS looks down at a half full BOWL of NUTS. A ROACH scampers out.
One of the nuts just walked away - Where’s the contact?
I hate hats -

Take it off - BARNEY irritably tosses his HAT to the table. At this very moment we see a SINGLE INDIVIDUAL enter the cantina. Because of the near non-existent interior light, coupled by the glare from outside, it is hard to make out stranger’s features.
(removing the hat) That’s the contact?
Could be.
Too bad she’s so homely.

Stay focused. Stepping forward is SANDRA (20’s.) She’s very attractive natural way. Her dark intense eyes fix on the TWO AMERICA BARNEY is taken by her profound physical presence. SANDRA warily approaches, visibly nervous.
(latin accent) I am Sandra - What are your names?
...Buddha and Pest.
Follow me, please. And without another word, she heads for the rear door of cantina.
‘Buddha and Pest...’
Relax.

Barney says nothing, gives Christmas a look like what the hell. EXT. GARZA’S PALACE WIDE SHOT of the COMPOUND. INT. GARZA’S CHAMBERS Extreme CLOSE UP of a smear of COLOR being spread across WHITE CANVAS. GARZA sits at an EASEL near the balcony painting a PORTRAIT OF HIMSELF. The image is disturbing a the majority of his face is a void as if to indicate his is hollow. The DOOR opens and MONROE enters followed by PAINE. THREE loyal RED BERET GUARDS glare at them.
Morning, General. (dryly) Let’s take a ride.
When I finish.
That’d be now. MONROE exits.

(to staring guards) ...See something. With thinly concealed disdain, the GUARDS turn away as PA also exits. GARZA can not match the gaze of his frustrate SOLDIERS as he passes. EXT. SANDRA’S PICK UP TRUCK - DAY Dust kicks up from the partially paved road as SANDRA dri her terribly rundown mini PICKUP TRUCK towards the outski of town.
On the visor are SIX SMALL SKILLFULLY SKETCHED PORTRAITS local women. One in particular stands out. A WOMAN’S WING PORTRAIT.
How long you stay?
One day.
Come and go, just like all the * rest. * SANDRA sees BARNEY eyeing her ARTWORK.
...You do these?
Yes - Take one - a gift.
I don’t take free gifts - How much * do you want? *
Nothin’. Takin’ money for * somethin’s not a gift. * SANDRA pulls it down and hands it to him.

Takin’ nothin’ for somethin’ is - * Reluctantly, Barney takes the WINGED WOMAN’S HEAD from SA and puts it in his pocket. 66 INT. SANDRA’S PICK UP TRUCK - DAY SANDRA drives while BARNEY sits in the middle and CHRISTM rides shotgun.
So what’re you doing here? *
Studying birds.
Really?
Yeah, studying birds that know how to survive, they sense when things are gonna change and just fly away. BARNEY glances at him like he’s lost his mind.
So how close can you get to the palace?
Why?
To see the view.
There’s no view.
Like to see it anyway.

Monroe stares at an unplanted field, with peasants lazily turning the soil. His mood is black. He turns to Garza. W is uncomfortable. Paine, and OPERATIVE #2 AND #3 stand of the side, eyeing several of Garza’s Red Berets.
Where’s the growth? Where’s the manpower?
People are getting weak.
Do you know how long it takes a coca plant to produce? Two months “ago!” We’re eight weeks behind schedule. Kick your peasants’ asses, I need my product!
When you talk this way to me in front of my men - It’s not good. MONROE closes to within inches of GARZA’S face.

(quietly) You're right, it’s embarrassing - Listen closely - I am the life line. I am the coordinator of all this confusion. I’m making you rich. Through my network, my contacts, and being wealthy is very good because it allows people to be the real ‘ass wipes’ nature intended them to be - No more faking it, but if you want me gone, shoot me, if you want ongoing wealth, grow thicker skin and get me my product. The fire in Monroe’s eyes burns into Garza.
(hard) This is not worth the money. MONROE smiles, backs off.
Sure it is. He stalks off, with his men following. Garza takes a deep breath, tries to regain his composure.

BARNEY, CHRISTMAS and SANDRA ride in SANDRA’S MINI-PICKUP TRUCK. They rock uncomfortably down a pot-holed road. The extreme poverty affects BARNEY. A group of SOLDIERS in RED BERETS have pinned several YOU MEN against a wall. They are being roughly interrogated, shoved into MILITARY TRUCKS.

It like this all the time? BARNEY looks out the window as their VEHICLE passes filth bare footed CHILDREN carrying BUCKETS of brackish water a joyless adults clad in near thread bare RAGS slump agains crumbling HOUSE/SHACKS.
(dryly) Yes, all the time. This place, this place you see now - was a beautiful place. (MORE )
SANDRA (cont'd) Then one day, they came with money and General Garza sells his soul, now you have a dying place.
You said ‘came with money.’ Who?
Some Americans - That’s all I know - But all this will change back.
You believe that? *
Yes, and the best day of our lives * will be the one when we can say our * lives are going to be our own * again. *
Nice thought. * BARNEY studies her committed expression.
You have family?
My mother died long ago - My father - He died too - You have family?
He has a truck an’ a seaplane.
If I were you I’d think about leavin’.
Why? It’s my country.
Look around.
I don’t understand.
You said it was dyin’. *
But it’s not dead!
SANDRA'S mood darkens.
(to Barney) Gettin’ kinda bleak. (to Sandra) Sometimes trying to be helpful, comes out wrong. Sandra, I was wonderin’ about somethin’ from, say, a female point of view. SANDRA does not understand.
What’re you doing?
Conversing - Look it up.
Be focused.
Be flexible. (to Sandra) Outta curiosity, ever have a person you, ah, say liked, or more, ask you to like get lost?
Get lost?
Y'know, go away, leave, not be with ‘em anymore.
Focus.
Chill - (to Sandra) Did it make you feel bad about yourself?
Bad...Yes. BARNEY shakes his head.
But we’re not bad people -
A little dignity.

Please - (to Sandra) Makes you wonder, is it us or them who’s messed up? I mean could a bad person ever say something like: ‘Tienes que encontrar un hombre que siempre se quedara despierto solo para verte dormir.’
(touched) That’s nice.
What'd Little Boy Blue say?
‘Someday I will find a man who will be happy just to watch me sleep.’
Hopeless.
Hopeless? ‘Cause I’m trying to connect with people’ - Try it sometime - I mean, why the hell are we in this world anyway! Look who I’m talkin’ to. (to Sandra) We close?
It’s just over there.
Pull over, please. SANDRA pulls over and CHRISTMAS steps out.
Anything wrong?
Nothin’, we just like to look at the view from different angles. (he leans in to Barney) You have a black heart. He moves off.
Cry baby. CHRISTMAS turns and angrily throws his hat then moves off
Let’s keep going.
BARNEY and SANDRA stand beside a BERM along the barely discernible dirt road.
Why’re you looking here? BARNEY walks off the road and looks at the PALACE in the distance. SANDRA is extremely uncomfortable.
Who're you really?
Birdwatcher.
I know you’re not what you say you are.
And who're you?
I told you my name.
You settin’ us up?
What does ‘settin’ up’ mean?
You don’t look like you belong in this.
A man came here - He asked a friend to show you what you want. He was afraid so he asked me too.
You’re not afraid.
Yes...But he said you may help - We should go. Suddenly they’re alerted by the GROANING ENGINE of a larg MILITARY TRUCK that quickly pulls into view. TEN ANGRY SOLDIERS wearing RED BERETS pile out.
Oh, God, please don’t say anything - Let me talk.
(in Spanish) What’re you doing here? Stay where you are! The TEN SOLDIERS surround BARNEY and SANDRA, WEAPONS held waist high.
(in Spanish) You were told never to come close.
(in Spanish) Why? You don’t own this place. Should we never leave our house? The SERGEANT LEADER steps uncomfortably close to SANDRA.
(in Spanish) You know better - You've been warned. The General’s daughter can be shot. BARNEY reacts to this.
(in Spanish to the soldier) Then do what you want - We are leaving - We did nothing wrong.
And him - Who is he? She violently shoves a SOLDIER. Suddenly the LEADER grabs SANDRA by the throat!  70
(in Spanish) Puta! Traitor! A RIFLE BUTT is buried into BARNEY’S KIDNEY. The LEADER j a PISTOL against BARNEY'S TEMPLE.
(in Spanish) Take her to her father! The LEADER goes to strike SANDRA with his PISTOL, but a K suddenly buries itself into his CHEST. CHRISTMAS steps fr his concealment.

Run! BARNEY snatches the REVOLVER from the DEAD LEADER. SANDRA takes off as CHRISTMAS throws another KNIFE throug the NECK of SOLDIER #2. Dropping low, BARNEY blows a hole through SOLDIER #3 and BARNEY then wheels around hitting SOLDIER #5 directly und the chin then SOLDIER #6 under his chin. Christmas nails soldier #7. SANDRA is running for her life as SOLDIER #8 races after Rushing forward, CHRISTMAS whips another KNIFE that burie itself into SOLDIER #9’s chest. The throaty engine of the TRANSPORT TRUCK roars to life a CHRISTMAS races into view. Without breaking stride CHRISTMAS tears into view and yan the THROWING KNIFE out of DEAD SOLDIER #9’s body, then ra through the foliage attempting to intercept the truck.

The truck’s frantic DRIVER yells into a WALKIE TALKIE as SOLDIER #8 attempts to shove Sandra onto the TRUCK, when KNIFE buries itself into his back. The DRIVER is still yelling into his WALKIE TALKIE when T SHOTS coming from behind CHRISTMAS blows the DRIVER #10 f first into the WINDSHIELD - The SHOOTER is BARNEY.  71 72 75

A bearded LIEUTENANT monitors the truck driver’s panicked transmission on his WALKIE-TALKIE, then the shots. Around are SIX SOLDIERS. EXT./INT. MONROE’S JEEP PAINE drives, MONROE is riding shotgun, in a foul mood. W his phone rings.
What? EXT. SANDRA’S TRUCK - DAY BARNEY drives the small TRUCK at breakneck speed down the treacherous road. INT. SANDRA’S TRUCK
(to Barney) We get outta here it’s a miracle - She’s going with us?
She better.
(frightened) Going where? How can we leave?
We have a plane. SANDRA says nothing.
PAINE and MONROE speed toward the village. INT. SANDRA’S TRUCK - DAY
Can’t leave!
You’ve don’t have a choice.  77
(loudly) Yes I do - I won’t run ever!
They’11 find you in an hour!
Maybe, but I am staying!
There’s nothin’ here!
Not to you!
(hard) Stay and you’re dead!! - You’re leavin’!
The TRUCK speeds towards the SEAPLANE MOORING. As they approach, the island’s CUSTOMS SHACK comes into v BARNEY skids the TRUCK nearly into a TREE and cuts the engine.
Fire it up - (gestures to the customs shack) I‘ll take them.
Give me a thirty second lead! Pointing to the customs shack. CHRISTMAS grabs a startled SANDRA’S hand.
It’‘ll be alright. As Barney sprints toward the plane, Christmas anxiously checks the sweeping SECONDS HAND of his watch.  78 79 80

In a JEEP a contingent of Garza’s troops barrel wildly do the narrow street nearly slamming into the many poor VEND and PEDESTRIANS, who leap from the thundering vehicle’s p One of the soldiers is yelling into a hand held RADIO as jeep’s HORN blares at an oncoming TRUCK that veers violen onto the sidewalk, and crashes into a STOREFRONT.
Monroe and PAINE and the other men race their JEEP at breakneck speed through the city.
CHRISTMAS jumps onto the PONTOON and whips open the huge planes’ SIDE DOOR. He turns to find Sandra standing still the dock.
